reference.title: euwatch-put-metric-alarm
reference.shortdesc: Creates a new alarm, or updates an existing alarm.

section.title: Syntax
section.codeblock: euwatch-put-metric-alarm AlarmName --comparison-operator value --evaluation-periods value --metric-name value --namespace value --period value --statistic value --threshold value [--actions-enabled value ] [--alarm-actions value[,value...] ] [--alarm-description value ] [--dimensions "key1=value1,key2=value2..." ] [--ok-actions value[,value...] ] [--unit value ] [--insufficient-data-actions value[,value...] ]

row.entry:
This determines if you want actions be executed when this alarm changes state.
Valid values: true | false
Describes what you want to do if the alarm changes state. The value is the Amazon resource name (ARN) of the resource you want to act on.

The operator with which the comparison with threshold will be made.
Valid values: GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold | GreaterThanThreshold | LessThanThreshold | LessThanOrEqualToThreshold
Dimensions of the metric on which to alarm.
Number of consecutive periods for which the value of the metric needs to be compared to threshold.
The name of the metric on which to alarm.
Namespace of the metric on which to alarm.
Describes what you want to do if the alarm goes to state OK. The value is the Amazon resource name (ARN) of the resource you want to act on.
Period of metric on which to alarm.

The statistic of the metric on which to alarm.
Valid values: SampleCount | Average | Sum | Minimum | Maximum
The threshold with which the metric value will be compared.
The unit of the metric on which to alarm.
Describes what you want to do if the alarm goes to state INSUFFICIENT_DATA. The value is the Amazon resource name (ARN) of the resource you want to act on.

section.title: Output
section.p: Eucalyptus does not return a response.

section.title: Example
section.p: The following example creates an alarm, test-alarm, that add a message to a topic when the CPU utilization of an instance exceeds 90% for three consecutive one minute periods.
section.codeblock: euwatch-put-metric-alarm test-alarm --alarm-description "some desc" --metric-name CPUUtilization --namespace AWS/EC2 --statistic Average --period 60 --threshold 90 --comparison-operator GreaterThanThreshold --dimensions AutoScalingGroupName=dev01 --evaluation-periods 3 --unit Percent --alarm-actions arn:aws:autoscaling::scalingPolicy:45e9ed16-9462-4905-b9d4-ff99fecc0d43 :autoScalingGroupName/dev01:policyName/cap01-add
